alert.note: Alert for Hillsborough; Rockingham; Strafford (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 28 at 5:55PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Maine, including the following county, York. Portions of New Hampshire, including the following counties, Hillsborough, Rockingham and Strafford. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 555 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Nashua, Derry, Rochester, Portsmouth, Hampton, Durham, Exeter, Salem, Dover and Somersworth.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
